title: Riot, would you kindly remove the surrender option?
body: Or at least tweak it so everyone has to accept, for a team game it's stupid to be decided by 4 people instead of 5.

replies.body: I know how u feel with the fact that the team loses motivation and tries to force the team to surrender but what if u all want to surrender so u can save time and start another game??

Surrender is essential in this game, since you know, there are enemy teams who would get cocky and refuse to end an already decided match for whatever reason.

To encourage positive attitude in matches, every surrender needs to be passed by nearly 100% agreement rate and each absent vote is counted as a No vote, that's already enough I say.

I agree, it's worse in DotA 2 where you can't surrender at all; fountain towers deal close to zero damage late game; and heroes that can pull you out of spawn range spawn camp you and continue griefing.
Luckily in normal matches, players are allowed to leave matches, if after 5 minutes, m one player in either side of the team has not returned from DCing. The DCing/AFK player does get punished for it but everyone else that leaves after that does not. 
Still, the DotA 2 community is a far more toxic and elitist atmosphere; "I'm better than noobs, so they don't deserve to play" type of mindset.

4 makes sense, heck 3 is even a majority.
If you dont like it being 4, you should be thank full its not 3, which is more then 2.

If anythnig, the surrender vote needs to be 3 yes's, instead of 4. 3 is a majority, why is the majority's opinion discarded in favour of the minority.

Also, Riot need to learn what abstaining means. A 3-0 surrender vote SHOULD PASS. ABSTAINING IS NOT A NO VOTE, IT IS NOT A VOTE, LEARN THE DIFFERENCE, 100% YES VOTES SHOULD PASS.

Abstaining is a different thing though, if there was an option to actually abstain then this would be accurate, however abstaining in the sense of surrendering is running out of time to vote, does that mean they would vote yes?

No it doesn't.
But 40% is a large number of players. They really wouldn't like that.
it takes 80pct of the team to surrender? If the team has a troll then he would just click no every time lol

>
> it takes 80pct of the team to surrender? If the team has a troll then he would just click no every time lol

Shouldn't be surrendering anyway.

But some people don't like to waste another 10-30 minutes playing a game that they obviously can't do anything because the enemy team destroy everyone in your team every team fight.
There are also other reasons like real life surprises. Pre-mades in your team might be planning to play a full match, but suddenly they have to go somewhere; they press "yes" especially because the match looks like it won't end soon or that there's a less than great chance of winning the match.

In saying that, I do understand the frustration when team members decide to surrender prematurely, just because of a badly played teamfight wherein they get aced once at 22 minute mark; when there is clearly a good chance of winning a match and plenty of opportunities to better oneself's plays.
Low ELO players should simply to not give up so quickly in games. I've had it happen to me a few times.

I tend to "no" surrenders by muscle memory to be honest. If we're clearly going nowhere after careful and considerate plays, and warding, then I consciously "yes" surrenders. Otherwise I more often than not am the person pressing "no" when everyone else picked "yes".
Why shouldn't you surrender? Surely if the game is hilariously one-sided you would rather just end it and start another one?
